issues.description: Constructor parameter ordering is inconsistent between RollerCoaster and LaunchedRollerCoaster in the solution, and this conflicts with the constructor-order requirement in the problem statement. In solution: RollerCoaster declares its constructor as RollerCoaster(String name, int numberOfLoopings, char abbreviation) while LaunchedRollerCoaster calls super(name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings). The mismatched ordering causes the super(...) call to pass an int where a char is expected (and vice versa) and will not compile. This also contradicts the exercise instruction that constructor parameters follow the UML attribute order (and the apparent intended ordering used in LaunchedRollerCoaster: name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings).
issues.suggested_fix: Make constructor parameter order consistent. A sensible fix is to align RollerCoaster's constructor with the ordering used by subclasses and the superclass attribute order: change RollerCoaster constructor to RollerCoaster(String name, char abbreviation, int numberOfLoopings) (or otherwise ensure all subclasses call super(...) with the same parameter order). Then have LaunchedRollerCoaster call super(name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings). This restores consistency with the UML/constructor-order requirement and prevents the compilation/type mismatch.
